conclusion: The objects (A, B, C, and D) are casting shadows on the ground due to a light source positioned over them.
Shadow A is at the leftmost side.
Shadow B is below and slightly to the right of object B.
Shadow C is between A and B.
Shadow D is below and to the right of object D.
The light source is moved forward and above the objects, closer to the top of the objects rather than directly above them.
Shadows will move closer to their respective objects because the light source is coming from a more direct overhead position.
Shadows will generally become smaller because the angle of incidence decreases when the light source moves forward, leading to shorter shadows.
The shadows will be smaller and closer to the objects compared to their initial positions. Shadows A, B, C, and D will move toward the respective objects and shrink in size.
